author: Sean Welsh
title: When is the Democratic debate?
text:
Sean Welsh Contact Reporter The Baltimore Sun A few things you need to know before Tuesday night's Democratic debate on CNN. 
Five Democrats vying for the party's presidential nomination for the 2016 general election will debate Tuesday night in Las Vegas. 
CNN will host the debate, featuring Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders, Martin O'Malley, Jim Webb and Lincoln Chaffee, with coverage beginning at 8:30 p.m. ET. The Democratic National Committee has the debate slated for 9 p.m. ET. 
Clinton will appear center-stage, flanked immediately by Sanders (to her right) and O'Malley (to her left), according to CNN . 
Vice President Joe Biden, said to be pondering a potential campaign for president, has been invited to participate. 
Anderson Cooper of CNN will moderate the debate, which is being held at the Wynn Las Vegas. 
Other upcoming debates: Nov. 14 | CBS News hosts a debate at Drake University in Des Moines, Iowa Dec. 19 | ABC News hosts a debate in Manchester, New Hampshire Jan. 17 | NBC News hosts a debate in Charleston, S.C. Feb. 11 | Univision/The Washington Post host a debate in Wisconsin March 9 | PBS hosts a debate in Miami
